page.title: 13Oceanography at Bidston.
page.content:
We visited Bidston Institute of Oceanography and were told of their specialised scientific work. Our group sat inside the Old Observation Dome. Research vessels are used off our coasts and instruments specially made for measuring currents , tides and storm surges.This information is for the Ministry of Defence (Navy) fishing boats, yachts, Port Authorities. These people need the information as they sail with high tides or must know about shipdocking arrangements , and the moving of oil rigs. We saw a buoy
for measuring currents, under repair. The Institute began predicting tides in 1867 and now predict two years ahead.These are sent to 50 major , 200 secondary British ports and some in Australia . Fifty percent of the predictions made are for Europe.
